resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
xhochy commented on pull request #3350: ARROW-4197: [C++] Better Emscripten support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3350#discussion_r246058876
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -256,9 +256,9 @@ find_package(Backtrace)
 foreach(LIB_TARGET ${ARROW_LIBRARIES})
   target_compile_definitions(${LIB_TARGET}
     PRIVATE ARROW_EXPORTING)
-  if (Backtrace_FOUND)
+  if (Backtrace_FOUND AND NOT DEFINED ARROW_WITH_BACKTRACE)
     target_compile_definitions(${LIB_TARGET}
-      PRIVATE ARROW_WITH_BACKTRACE)
+      ARROW_WITH_BACKTRACE)
 
 Review comment:
   Please use one of `INTERFACE|PUBLIC|PRIVATE`. This should only be transitive when we use it in headers (which we don't).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3350#discussion_r246155518
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -170,6 +170,10 @@ static|shared (default shared)")
     "If off, 'quiet' flags will be passed to linting tools"
     OFF)
 
+  option(ARROW_GGDB_DEBUG
+    "Pass -ggdb flag to debug builds"
+    OFF)
 
 Review comment:
   I want to use `-g3` instead of `-ggdb` or `-g`.
   We can expand macro in GDB with `-g3`.
   
   Does `-g3` work  with Emscripten?

timkpaine commented on issue #3350: ARROW-4197: [C++] Better Emscripten support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3350#issuecomment-452909660
 
 
   @wesm not for this one, I think that its probably worth making a separate issue for other flags (like the -g3 @kou wanted). I need to wait for https://github.com/google/double-conversion/pull/86 to go through before it all works without a separate patch, but for now we have a proof of concept hooking perspective up to arrow using pure c++ and webassembly rather than relying on the arrowjs library ([here](https://github.com/timkpaine/perspective/tree/arrow)).

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
The emscripten compiler ([https://kripken.github.io/emscripten-site/)] fails when compiling arrow with a few relatively minor issues:

 
 * there is no -ggdb flag for debug support, only -g
 * there is no execinfo.h, so even if Backtrace is found it cannot be used
 * when using the emscripten compiler, even on mac, you cannot pass the -undefined dynamic_lookup argument
